meanings.definition: To give a false or misleading account of something.
meanings.sent1: She tried to misrepresent the facts to make herself look better.
meanings.sent2: It is not right to misrepresent the truth to avoid getting in trouble.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that he would misrepresent his age to get senior discounts.
meanings.sent4: The artist's abstract painting seemed to misrepresent reality in a fascinating way.
meanings.sent5: The detective's job is to uncover the truth and not misrepresent the evidence.

meanings.definition: To present in a false or inaccurate way.
meanings.sent1: The company may misrepresent their products to boost sales.
meanings.sent2: Politicians should not misrepresent their opponents' views to win votes.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick seemed to misrepresent the laws of physics.
meanings.sent4: The mirror in the funhouse misrepresents your reflection in a hilarious manner.
meanings.sent5: The news article was found to misrepresent the events leading up to the incident.
